channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: NDP 2020: Heartland celebrations pay tribute to healthcare workers, front-line fighters
item.description:
August 09, 2020 1:27 PM

Earlier on Sunday morning, the fan favourite Red Lions landed gracefully on grass fields near Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and Sengkang General Hospital.

item.title: NDP 2020: Heartland celebrations
item.description:
August 09, 2020 12:50 PM

Share your best photos of Singapore's 55th birthday celebrations on Instagram with the hashtag #stheartlandndp to be featured.

item.title: NDP 2020: Masked, but not muted - parade on Padang kicks off celebrations
item.description:
August 09, 2020 11:02 AM

The ceremonial parade took place in the morning this year, unlike in the past when it was incorporated into the evening song-and-dance segments.

item.title: NDP 2020: Special brooch and scarf worn by President Halimah feature artwork by persons with disabilities
item.description:
August 09, 2020 10:30 AM

SINGAPORE - Sharp-eyed Singaporeans would have spotted the unique designs on the red-and-white silk cotton scarf and colourful enamel brooch that President Halimah Yacob donned at the Padang parade on Sunday morning (Aug 9).

item.title: NDP 2020: Upcoming NS Square at Marina Bay will be 'central focus' of new downtown, says PM Lee
item.description:
August 09, 2020 10:13 AM

SINGAPORE - The upcoming NS Square, set to replace the Marina Bay floating platform, will be the central focus of the new downtown area, said Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong in his National Day message on Sunday (Aug 9).

item.title: NDP 2020: Unity and resilience of Singaporeans give confidence that nation will pull through Covid-19 crisis, says PM Lee
item.description:
August 09, 2020 10:10 AM

The determination of S'poreans to stand firm together in the face of adversity since the nation's birth is why he is confident the Republic will get through the pandemic, as it has in previous crises, he said on Sunday.

item.title: National Day celebrations from the Padang and across S’pore
item.description:
August 09, 2020 9:30 AM

Catch the action live as Singapore marks its 55th birthday.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 9
NDP 2020: Live blog
item.description:
August 09, 2020 7:35 AM

Get the latest highlights of this year’s National Day Parade celebrations as Singapore marks its 55th birthday.

item.title: It Changed My Life: Reinventing work spaces, with help from mother's fruit cakes
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Co-working start-up pioneer Grace Sai says it's more meaningful if a business is purpose-led.

item.title: Solemnising couples' marriages over Zoom
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Since May, 71-year-old Mr Koh Kok Weng has solemnised 109 weddings through video conferencing platform Zoom, amid the health precautions required by Covid-19.

item.title: Fighting a pandemic: Leo Yee Sin
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

PROFESSOR LEO YEE SIN NCID executive director Public Administration Medal (Silver) When the coronavirus arrived in Singapore early this year, the country's key infectious diseases body had to move fast to respond, even though it was new and untested.

item.title: Faces of NDP 2020: Celebrating Singaporeans
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Amid the pandemic, NDP 2020 will scale down on the ceremonial aspects and focus on celebrating the contributions of ordinary Singaporeans.

item.title: Champion for a single salary structure: Chan Lai Fung
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

MS CHAN LAI FUNG

item.title: A National Day like no other: Apart today, but always together
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

There may not be the traditional coming together of tens of thousands of Singaporeans, but today's more sombre National Day Parade is a rallying call to reaffirm Singapore's collective confidence in its future.

item.title: Barber aims to give old shop a cutting edge
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

As a teenager following around his grandfather - the man who started the Sri Dewana barber shop chain - Mr Muhamad Syuhadak knew this was his calling, too.

item.title: The show must go on for NDP parade commander Nicholas Ong
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The commander of this year's National Day Parade (NDP) has a trick to keep his white face mask in place while shouting his thunderous commands: cosmetic tape.

item.title: Helped the library save 7,500 man-hours: Puspa Amir Yeow
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

In her 26 years at Temasek Polytechnic (TP), Mrs Puspa Amir Yeow has played an active role in spearheading the library's digital transformation.

item.title: Housewife cooks for elderly residents
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

After befriending elderly residents living alone in her Yio Chu Kang neighbourhood, housewife Diljan Shaik Arif Ali found that many of them prefer home-cooked fare to that sold at food stalls.

item.title: Creating an isolation facility in four days
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Healthcare director Jessie Ho, 54, had just four days' notice to create a community isolation facility at the Singapore Expo. The number of Covid-19 cases had hit 1,000 in Singapore on April 1 and cases in migrant worker dorms were rising.

item.title: Bringing mobile column to the heartland
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Planning for this year's National Day Parade (NDP) began in earnest last September, almost immediately after NDP 2019, Lieutenant-Colonel Low Youwen recalls.

item.title: Making the Singapore Prison Service a well-regarded correctional system: Desmond Chin
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

MR DESMOND CHIN Commissioner of Prisons

item.title: Marching in mum's footsteps 47 years later
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

In 1973, his mother, then a Secondary 3 student, marched past the historic Padang as part of the Girl Guides contingent for that year's National Day Parade (NDP).

item.title: NDP 2020: Through our lenses, through the years
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

FROM B8-9

item.title: Evening show optimised for a home audience
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Though it had long been a dream of local film-maker and director Royston Tan to direct the National Day Parade show, he never expected to be staging one in the midst of a pandemic.

item.title: Raising the profile of S'pore in the international meteorological community: Wong Chin Ling
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

MS WONG CHIN LING Director-General of the Meteorological Service Singapore Public Administration Medal (Silver) (Bar)

item.title: Navy man takes his sea vessel into heartland
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Navy man Vaengadis Waran is taking his seafaring vessel into unusual territory today - dry land.

item.title: All bus drivers among 11,000 transport staff to be tested for Covid-19
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The extra precaution comes after last month's discovery of an infection cluster at Bukit Panjang's transport centre.

item.title: Making a united Singapore
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

What does a united Singapore mean to you?

item.title: Sole Red Lions woman will land in Sengkang
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's first and only woman member of the Red Lions, Second Warrant Officer Shirley Ng, will be part of this year's crew of parachutists landing in the heartland.

item.title: Carving out new areas of development for energy and chemicals: Khalil A. Bakar
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

MR KHALIL A. BAKAR Director (Energy & Climate Policy), Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment Public Administration Medal (Bronze)

item.title: FairPrice manager tells of team effort
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Supermarket branch manager Mohamed Amin is unable to forget how items flew off the shelves in a wave of panic buying after the Dorscon (Disease Outbreak Response System Condition) level was raised to orange in February.

item.title: National Day promotions pull in crowds of shoppers
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Tills are ringing again after retailers pulled out all the stops to draw shoppers with promotions ahead of National Day.

item.title: At 25, hoping for a more inclusive country
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Growing up, I was lucky enough to catch the National Day Parade live on more than one occasion, while in other years, my friends, the family and I would crowd around the television set at home.

item.title: Heng salutes S'poreans for Covid-19 response
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

While the Covid-19 pandemic has affected millions around the world, Singaporeans have responded to it with unity, fortitude and resilience, Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat said yesterday.

item.title: Leading the commemoration of Singapore's bicentennial: Gene Tan
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

When he was handed the task of leading Singapore's year-long bicentennial commemoration last year, Mr Gene Tan felt a heavy responsibility. "This was a priceless chance to move the needle on how Singaporeans see ourselves and our history," said Mr Tan, 50.

item.title: Dancer guarantees a show to remember
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Having performed in more National Day Parades (NDPs) than she can remember, dancer Jacqueline Theresa Pereira will be returning to the NDP stage to perform in a character role as well as a modern dance in two acts of the evening show.

item.title: Bukit Panjang bus service changes: Ministry working with MPs to mitigate impact of changes
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Transport and the Land Transport Authority (LTA) will work with Bukit Panjang MP Liang Eng Hwa and Holland-Bukit Timah GRC MP Edward Chia over the National Day weekend to explore options to mitigate the impact of changes to three bus services.

item.title: Bukit Panjang to city stretch of DTL incurs $60m subsidy a year
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

About $60 million a year in public funds goes towards subsidising operations for a stretch of the MRT Downtown Line (DTL) connecting Bukit Panjang to the city, Transport Minister Ong Ye Kung said.

item.title: Overseas Singaporeans join in to mark special day
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

While people in Singapore will be watching the National Day Parade show from the comfort of their homes, 25-year-old master's student Liaw Su Xin will be catching the live show in the middle of a dense forest.

item.title: Sharing insight on water issues: Shawn Lum
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

DR SHAWN LUM President, Nature Society (Singapore) Former member, PUB Water Network Panel Public Service Medal

item.title: Stepping up to help at screening centre National Day 2020
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

When Covid-19 struck, 46-year-old Maryann Sheila - a front-line registration worker at an orthopaedic clinic in Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) - rose to the occasion.

item.title: 25 cases linked to new cluster at Kian Teck Way dorm
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

A dormitory at 35 Kian Teck Way has emerged as a new cluster of Covid-19 infections, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Jayakumar tops list of 5,470 honoured on National Day
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Former senior minister S. Jayakumar, who is senior legal adviser to the Foreign Minister, has been awarded Singapore's highest civilian honour, the Order of Temasek (With High Distinction), for his sustained and invaluable contributions to Singapore.

item.title: National Day Awards 2020
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Here are the recipients of this year's National Day honours:

item.title: Serving workers, ensuring their livelihoods are secure: Richard Tan
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Veteran trade unionist Tan Richard, 54, who is also a member of the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) central committee, is a strong advocate for workers' training and career progression.

item.title: Family-run Ponggol Seafood keeping afloat
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Times are tough amid the Covid-19 pandemic for Ponggol Seafood, a family-run restaurant famous for its chilli crab and mee goreng that has been around since 1969.

item.title: Singapore bars with no food shop licence remain closed
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Every other day, home-grown cocktail bar Jigger & Pony's phone rings as concerned customers call to ask when the bar will reopen.

item.title: Coronavirus: Karaoke bars find new licensing rules to reopen a challenge
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Two weeks ago, Forest Darts Cafe raised the shutters on its Downtown East and Anson Road outlets after a four-month hiatus.

item.title: Almost half a century dedicated to Malay Youth Literary Association: Izzuddin Taherally
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

MR IZZUDDIN TAHERALLY President, Malay Youth Literary Association Public Service Star (Bar)

item.title: Encouraging the aged in the South West CDC: Azlinda Anwar
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

With her extensive experience in the research and healthcare industries, Dr Azlinda Anwar, 51, has helped to shape the direction of many programmes at the South West Community Development Council (CDC), including schemes that promote active ageing and community health.

item.title: Helping others find jobs amid downturn
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

For dedicated career adviser Fauzyah Johari, work does not end when a client lands a job.

item.title: 240 couples tie the knot on auspicious Aug 8 date despite curbs
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

For Ms Zhuang Yaqi and Mr Ryan Liu, getting married on Aug 8 had been in the works for over a year - 0808 is "auspicious" and it is the day before National Day.

item.title: Nightclubs struggle to survive amid Covid-19 restrictions
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Landlords are knocking on the doors of bars, pubs and nightclubs that stay shuttered.

item.title: Selecting candidates for the public sector: Lily Kong
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Since 2009, Professor Lily Kong has been lending the Public Service Commission (PSC) her experience in assessing and developing university students.

item.title: Re-imagine Singapore as a care economy
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

As a volunteer career coach with a non-profit organisation, I have spoken to six Singapore residents and listened to their stories in recent months.

item.title: Ferrying healthcare staff to and from work
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Aloysius Lee used to only transport passengers for Grab, but with more people staying at home because of the coronavirus, he joined the firm's food and parcel delivery services in April.

item.title: Instrumental in the set-up of the National Centre for Infectious Diseases: Benjamin Ong
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

ASSOCIATE PROFESSOR BENJAMIN ONG

item.title: Customers stay away as gold prices surge to record high
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

Gold shops have seen a drop in customers of at least 30 per cent as gold prices surge to record highs, with one jeweller in Little India saying this is the "lowest point" in the store's 25 years of operations.

item.title: Leader in women's empowerment and advocacy work: Joanna Portilla
item.description:
August 09, 2020 5:00 AM

MS JOANNA PORTILLA Member of the Advisory Council on Community Relations in Defence (Accord) Public Service Star
